root: ^In this land, there are five Houses: House Belladonna, House Holly, House Cherry-Blossom ,House Ivy, and House Spider-Lilly. Each house has unique virtues: House Belladonna is diligent, House Holly is kind, House Cherry-Blossom is patient, House Ivy is humble, and House Spider-Lilly displays temperance. However, despite these virtues, the Houses are also plagued by sins. In fear of conflict, some inhabitants choose not to align with any houses, including you.
^Well, that's got to be it. She's innocent after all. Phew. Six solved cases in one day, that's got to be a new record. Heh, I should give myself a raise.
^Hey boss, I got the information to the constables. They'll make an arrest by the end of the night.
^The cat that was stolen out of the tree. Poor old lady was horrified. She thought they were helping her, but they just ran off with the cat.
^That's good news. That case was weighing on my mind all last night, couldn't sleep a wink.
^I didn't take you for a cat lover.
^I'm an empath for all living creatures.
^Oh, also, I picked up a few new cases from House Cherry Blossom. Our Lord is making efforts to lower the crime rates in the land, and as such, every minor case is being treated far more seriously.
^That's good, I think? I can get to those tomorrow. I'm tired.
^No worries, you've been working yourself hard today. You know, House Cherry Blossom could really use a talented investigator like you.
^Why would they need me when they have you in the family?
^Never a shortage of talent to be had. The more people on board, the more people we can help.
^You know my stance on Houses, Ariar.

^Yeah, yeah, you're all about staying neutral. I get that. What's that thing you always say: 'wherever you wander, wherever you roam....' No, that's not it. Ah, yes, 'One in distress can be saved, a house in distress cannot.' I understand, but if you ever do decide to join a House, We'd, I mean, I'd love to have you with us.
^How about you give me your sales pitch after we've finished locking up for the night. We'll go to Trello Tavern and you can give it another shot.
^Fine, but you should know, I'm being completely serious. You're wasted in your neutrality.
^[holds up finger, waving sternly] A-ba-bah-bah! Save it for Trello's! Now can you turn off the lights? I'll get the door.
^There is sudden knocking at the door. A letter is slid under the door. It is marked with an urgent notice.
^Some sort of letter. It says it's urgent.
^Well in that case, let's open it.
^Nothing, really. It's just an address and one word: Help. I don't know if we should trust this or not. What if it's a trap?
^But what if it's not? You should go. I'll stay behind just in case something bad happens, you can call me.
^Nor am I, but don't worry, how many times have I let you die?

^I just want to stay that way. But what if you are right, and something truly if wrong. What if someone needs help, and I didn't come to their aid? If something bad does happen, and I could have helped, I don't know if I could live with that. Okay, I'll go. But be ready for my call in case I'm the next one with an urgent call for help.
